page.title: 05ALTERNATIVE TRANSPORT
page.content: As there is no regular bus serving Ravenglass there is a community car scheme financed by Cumbria County Council and administered by the WRVS using volunteer drivers who receive 17p/ml,(10p/ml paid by the user and 7p/ml paid by the WRVS).It costs Â£1.50 to visit the surgery and considerably more to visit council offices,clinics, relatives in hospital,etc. However for people referred by doctors there is,in addition to the normal ambulances,a well-developed hospital car service using volunteer car-owners. From Easter to October the 'Mountain Goat'minibus service calls into Ravenglass as part of day trips from Windermere and Keswick. There is a regular bus service along the main A595 road provided by BNFL for its shift workers.
